item.title: Darkest Dungeon 2: All Pets, Ranked
item.description:
The Stagecoach comprises core gameplay mechanics in Darkest Dungeon 2 that do more than just drive our heroes and adventurers through all sorts of horrors. The vehicle can be equipped with different items to improve combat and survival effectiveness, including a cute little Pet for a variety of buffs.

Once players reach the first Inn after starting a new run, they can choose one of 10 different Pets for their Stagecoach, depending on how many they have unlocked from the Altar of Hope in Darkest Dungeon 2 .

Each Pet plays a role in how players build their team of heroes. From improving relationships and healing capabilities to stacking health and bolstering various resistances, having a Pet on the Stagecoach is not just for show. They synergize with Stagecoach items as well as with heroes. Hence, the right fluffy companion can help fend off the lurking horrors in the shadows.

Here are the best (and worst) Pets players should be keeping an eye on in Darkest Dungeon 2 .

10 Unnatural Owlet

Increased Chance to Apply Debuffs

Description

  • +5 percent debuff resistance piercing per Tinker's Gear Equipped
  • Increased chance of producing items from Stagecoach Items

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 15

The Unnatural Owlet is a counterpart to the Mucilaginous Slime, and a highly situational Pet in the game. It improves the chance of heroes bypassing enemies' resistance to apply debuffs. With a lot of great debuff skills to choose from, especially if players are running an Occultist debuff build in Darkest Dungeon 2 , the Unnatural Owlet ensures that no turn goes to waste. That said, there is no guarantee that debuff skills will always proc, especially against the final bosses. RNG still plays a role with the Pet.

Additionally, the secondary passive of nearly doubling the chance of producing Stagecoach items is useful for cranking overpowered Combat items. However, again, most hero compositions will rely on their main damage-dealing skills instead of an RNG-gotten trap. The former is just more efficient at closing out rounds quicker.

9 Larval Carrion Eater

Gain Heals and Tokens via Killing Corpses

Description

  • Heal 30 percent and gain Block + Crit tokens for killing corpses

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 60

The Larval Carrion Eater can prove highly effective in fights where players can afford to use AoE skills to whittle down enemies. This is often in situations where enemies move around while attacking. In Creature Dens, for example, a pistol Highway Robber and grenade Plague Doctor are best used to beat the dancing spiders. Their AoE attacks can kill corpses to significantly heal and gain Block and Crit tokens, making their next turn powerful.

The General's Dream grants players 200 percent damage against corpses, but getting the lair boss trophy is a gamble. Beating the Dreaming General in Darkest Dungeon 2 can prove difficult without the right party combination.

However, the corpse-dependent gameplay makes the Larval Carrion Eater a highly situational Pet in Darkest Dungeon 2 . If players forcefully focus on killing corpses for their buffs, they are only wasting precious rounds which can be used to damage enemies directly. This makes the Larval Carrion Eater a fairly weak pet in most cases.

8 Pygmy Pliskin

Better (and More) Heals

Description

  • +10 percent healing received from skills per Medical Gear equipped
  • Random hero heals 10 percent after each location

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 10

The secret to surviving in Darkest Dungeon 2 is doing enough damage to close out encounters in as few rounds as possible. Hence, damage will always triumph over healing effectiveness. Considering how the sequel is more generous regarding heals when compared to the first game, the Pygmy Pliskin becomes a Pet to trap new players. The bonus heals, while great, will not take Darkest Dungeon 2 players far when playing the final, harder chapters.

Additionally, Flagellant and Plague Doctor, the best-ranking healers in Darkest Dungeon 2 , are also excellent at dealing damage. When used right, players will never require the healing bonuses from the Pygmy Pliskin.

7 Shrieker Chick

More Baubles for Shopping

Description

  • +2 percent CRIT per Scouting Gear equipped
  • +2 quantity of looted baubles

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 45

The Shrieker Chick doubles the amount of baubles players earn from all sources, allowing them to have more money to spend after reaching an Inn or the Hoarder. While the additional Crit bonus is always welcomed, Scouting Gear does not offer as much value as the others.

For example, scouting Hero Shrines becomes useless after players have maxed out all the heroes in Darkest Dungeon 2 . Additionally, there are other ways to gain scouting bonuses, meaning there is little point in focusing on so many resources to find the best routes or specific locations.

6 Shambler's Spawn

Unlocks Cultist Trinkets

Description

  • -100 percent location and route scouting
  • +200 percent Oblivion Ingress scouting
  • +33 percent Oblivion Ingresses

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 155

With the Shambler's Spawn, players can use Cultist trinkets without pairing them with a Dark Impulse in Darkest Dungeon 2 . This gives players plenty of flexibility with their builds, allowing them to combine different trinkets for all their heroes for various effects.

With the Pet spawning more Oblivion Ingresses, and also scouting all of them, players are guaranteed to find a trove of Cultist trinkets for their team during a single run. Some ludicrously powerful Cultist trinkets can make short work of lair bosses. However, what trinkets players find and how they combine them determines whether equipping the Shambler's Spawn is worth it.

5 Hatchling Crocodilian

Boosts Dancing Compositions

Description

  • +3 DMG for 1 battle when moving
  • -1 Speed (20 percent) for 1 battle when moving

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 95

The Hatchling Crocodilian is one of the last Darkest Dungeon 2 Pets to unlock, and is significantly powerful. The only problem is that it is designed specifically for dancing compositions, meaning players must have moving heroes such as Jester, Grave Robber, Crusader, or Duelist to get any use out of the Hatchling Crocodilian.

Despite its situational aspect, the Hatchling Crocodilian can prove overpowered in the right hands, often increasing damage for heroes up to 30 percent in a few rounds. This, of course, is only useful if the heroes are moving with each attack.

Dancing compositions are incredibly tricky to pull off, requiring players to have an excellent understanding of their heroes and skills.

4 Mucilaginous Slime

Run Over Debris for Loot

Description

  • +5 percent debuff resistance per Road Gear equipped
  • Increased chance of looting items from road debris

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 35

The Mucilaginous Slime might seem underwhelming because it relies on road debris, but only a few runs should prove why it is one of the most useful Pets in Darkest Dungeon 2 . Every time players run over road debris, they have a chance of obtaining random loot. The Mucilaginous Slime increases this chance by three times for Food and Combat items and by two times for Relics. Hence, players have a better chance of getting specific items for their heroes, and most importantly, more Relics to spend at the Inn.

Additionally, considering the number of debuffs in the game, gaining +20 percent resistance to enemy debuffs with four Road Gear equipped is always helpful.

3 Crimson Tick

Gain Horror for Powerful Buffs

Description

  • +8 percent chance of producing The Blood on killing blows

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 105

None of the other Pets can match the power of the Crimson Tick. It gives players a small chance of looting The Blood on killing blows, a consumable Combat item that gives Strength, Crit, and Speed tokens alongside a three-round Horror token. This is an insanely strong set of buffs in return for a few Stress points that heroes can either resist or heal.

Crimson Tick generates around four Blood vials on average. Save them for the most difficult bosses in Darkest Dungeon 2 .

For heroes that can buff themselves to deal massive upfront damage such as Hellion and Leper, the Crimson Blood makes them hilariously stronger by stacking more offensive tokens. In addition, since the Crimson Tick does not rely on any specific Stagecoach item or gear, players are free to equip whatever they deem best.

2 Reanimated Rabbit

More Health and Faster Turn Speed

Description

  • +1 Speed per Food Gear equipped
  • +1 HP per 4 Food in inventory

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 25

The Reanimated Rabbit is another highly recommended Pet players should consider in Darkest Dungeon 2 . Stacking Food Stagecoach Items gives the entire party two powerful passive buffs to improve their survival and combat effectiveness.

Firstly, all heroes get increased Speed, which means they get to attack before enemies. Secondly, everyone gains bonus health, allowing even the squishiest heroes to soak damage without reaching Death's Door in Darkest Dungeon 2 .

Most fights are determined within the first round. Leveraging the Reanimated Rabbit to have all four heroes take their turns first means players can potentially beat one or two enemies, reducing their damage output in the next round.

Lastly, Food Gear is incredibly powerful in Darkest Dungeon 2 . Depending on the Stagecoach Item equipped, players can stack Food to improve their Resolute chance and Disease resistance. Even better, players get to produce Flapjacks and Invigorating Stew, two of the best Inn items in Darkest Dungeon 2 .

1 Orphan Wolf Cub

Max Relationships for Powerful Combos

Description

  • +5 percent stress resistance per Luxury Gear equipped
  • +10 percent positive relationship chance

Candles of Hope to Unlock

  • 5

Despite being the first Pet players unlock, the Orphan Wolf Cub is unarguably the best and easiest Pet to use in Darkest Dungeon 2 . Equipping four Luxury Items boosts Stress resistance by 20 percent , allowing players to focus more on dealing damage instead of wasting a turn on Stress healing.

The biggest advantage of the Orphan Wolf Cub, though, is the additional 10 percent chance of heroes forming positive relationships with each other. This makes relationship-improving Inn items far more effective and less likely to fail.

Rest assured that all four heroes in a party will hit maximum affinity before reaching the final boss during a run without relying solely on RNG.

Reducing stress further increases the chance of gaining positive affinity, which stacks with the Orphan Wolf Cub.

Improving relationships between heroes increases their combat effectiveness. They gain a chance to apply powerful buffs to each other during combat such as increasing attack damage or dodge chance, reducing stress, removing status effects, or healing them.

While players are still expected to strategize around the Orphan Wolf Cub, the Pet is far easier (and straightforward) to use compared to most of the other Pets, especially for players new to Darkest Dungeon 2 .

item.title: Longest Action JRPGs, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Action JRPGs can be lengthy like turn-based ones, with games like Dragon's Dogma 2 taking over 30 hours to beat.
  • Kingdom Hearts 2 feels longer due to revisiting worlds, while Yakuza 5 and Dragon's Dogma provide rich narratives in 36-36.5 hours.
  • Final Fantasy 16 offers a unique character action experience, lasting 37.5 hours, while Star Ocean: The Last Hope delivers 44 engaging hours.

When people think of JRPGs, the first thing that comes to most people's minds are turn-based games like Final Fantasy and Dragon Quest . However, plenty of games under that umbrella utilize real-time combat systems. Even the aforementioned series dabble in them from time to time.

Action JRPGs tend to be shorter than their turn-based kin, but a few beefy ones surpass a lot of turn-based JRPGs in their length. The shortest game on the list below takes 30 hours to beat. The games closer to the top are impressively long and offer a lot of depth in addition to the fast-paced combat.

All times are taken from howlongtobeat.com

9 Dragon's Dogma 2

30.5 Hours

This is a sequel many people wanted, but never thought would happen. Thankfully, it did, and Dragon's Dogma 2 retains the quirks and unique systems that made the first game so special.

The game comes in a few hours shorter than its predecessor, but most people will spend more than 30 hours in this game as they tackle side quests and the new game plus mode. Two console generations passed between the first and second games, and it is not necessary to need to play the first to understand the successor.

8 Kingdom Hearts 2

32 Hours

The sequel to the surprise PS2 mega hit adds a lot of polish to the core gameplay and includes even more Disney worlds and characters. The game feels a lot longer than its sequel, since players end up visiting many of the worlds at least twice.

It is good that Kingdom Hearts 2 is such a meaty adventure, since the third entry in the series did not come for more than ten years. At least the spin-offs like Birth by Sleep and Dream Drop Distance were great additions to the series and still expanded the lore in the meantime.

7 Yakuza 5

36 Hours

The series, now known as Like a Dragon , is as epic of a tale as gaming can get. There is a throughline all the way from the debut entry up until the recent games. Fortunately, it is possible to jump in at almost any game and get a satisfying experience, even if some narrative nuances fly over newcomers' heads.

After all, Yakuza 5 alone takes 36 hours to beat, and that does not include side content. Throw the other games in, and players are looking at well over 100 hours of gaming at a minimum to catch up.

These games in particular can inflate in length thanks to the varied and diverse side-quests.

6 Dragon's Dogma

36.5 Hours

Dragon's Dogma is almost on par with Demon's Souls with how it perplexed gamers upon release. Players slowly discovered how to utilize the game's systems and deal with its odd mechanics, discovering a genius RPG within.

The time spent in Dragon's Dogma's world will involve a lot of trial and error and experimentation, but it is all a blast. The game never felt like it belonged in the gaming landscape when it first came out, which has only helped it age gracefully in the years since.

5 Ys 8: Lacrimosa Of Dana

37 Hours

The eighth entry in this oddly named series stands as a particularly long and beefy one. The other games are at an average length for the genre, but Ys 8 takes its time and stretches its run time to 37 hours.

This is almost twice as long as some of the other games in the series. The game has a long runway to get going, so do not expect to get pulled in right away. It is a rewarding adventure for those who stick with it, though.

4 Final Fantasy 16

37.5 Hours

Final Fantasy 16 threw a right hook when it revealed itself to be not only an action RPG, but a character action game that eschews many gameplay conventions of its predecessors. Players are in full control of Clive and play it as they would Devil May Cry or Bayonetta .

Fortunately, it is a much longer journey than those examples and filled with jaw-dropping setpieces involving the trademark summons. Players can pad this game time with side quests, but they aren't missing a lot if they opt to just do the main story.

3 Star Ocean: The Last Hope

44 Hours

The first Star Ocean game for the PS3 and Xbox 360 generation did not skimp on the content. Still, it is not the longest game in the series. The Last Hope's story is nothing to write home about, but its gameplay is more than engaging enough to keep players interested throughout the whole 44-hour journey.

In an era where this was slowly going away, the Xbox 360 version came on three discs. Regularly switching between them depending on where they are going in the game grows annoying fast, unfortunately.

2 Star Ocean: Till The End Of Time

46 Hours

Till The End of Time's release was overshadowed by a small controversy regarding it not working on older PS2 models. In the passing years, it has been able to stand on its own as a video game and prove itself as a worthy addition to the legendary series. It also fits a lot of game for the era, which could be a good or a bad thing depending on how one feels about JRPG conventions of the early 2000s.

1 Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

47.5 Hours

It is hard to believe just how detailed the world is in Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . It delivers on the promise of applying the same detail to the rest of the planet as Final Fantasy 7 Remake did to Midgar. The main story alone takes almost 50 hours to beat, but this extends to well over one hundred once side quests get involved.

While some players might not like all of the side quests, they all include great character moments, making them especially worthwhile for fans of the original. The journey is also filled with enough minigames to rival the Like a Dragon series.

item.title: Pokemon GO: Dynamax Krabby Max Battle Guide (Max Monday)
item.description:
Dynamax and Gigantamax Pokemon were introduced in Pokemon GO through the Max Out Season, including the new Power Spots mechanic, which are on-map objectives that will show up during your adventure and give you an opportunity to earn Max Particles and participate in Dynamax Battles. Max Monday has continued to become a recurring event through the following Dual Destiny Season, incorporating new Dynamax bosses to create a more versatile range of Dynamax and Gigantamax Pokemon in the game.

As Max Mondays are short, recurring events, Trainers have limited time to prepare for each one before the designated featured Pokemon takes over all nearby Power Spots and gives players an opportunity to go up against it in battle time and time again. On December 9, 2024 , Krabby is appearing as the Max Monday featured boss, meaning Trainers will need to consider the key weaknesses, resistances, and best counters for this monster ahead of time in order to make the most of this limited opportunity. Everything you need to know about Krabby's Max Monday event has been included in the guide below.

Pokemon GO Max Monday: Dynamax Krabby Max Battle Guide

In Pokemon GO, Krabby is featured in the November 9 Max Monday event as the designated Max Battle boss. The Max Monday event on this date begins on 6 PM local time, and concluded on 7 PM local time , giving Trainers just one hour to make the most of Krabby's appearances throughout all local Power Spots, and hopefully capture one or more suitable Krabby specimens to add to their collection. For Trainers wondering about Krabby's potential, Gigantamax Kingler is one of the many G-Max specimens in existence, and with Krabby's arrival as a Dynamax specimen in Pokemon GO , Trainers will eventually be able to evolve it to gain their own Gigantamax Kingler.

Dynamax Krabby Weaknesses & Resistances

In Pokemon GO , Krabby is a pure Water Type Pokemon, meaning that its core weaknesses and resistances are fairly straightforward to keep in mind. Krabby is resistant to Fire, Ice, Steel, and Water Type Pokemon, so players should aim to avoid incorporating such specimens into their Max Battle teams whenever possible, to avoid any disadvantages when going up against Dynamax Krabby.

Krabby has its damage potential increased when battling in Rain weather, thanks to the Weather Boost mechanic . For this reason, Trainers may wish to keep this in mind and avoid Max Battles against Krabby in such areas, whenever possible.

Luckily, Krabby also takes increased damage from Grass and Electric Types, so players should instead attempt to incorporate these attributes into their lineups and utilize monsters who can deliver strong attacks of these Types.

Dynamax Krabby Counters

In Pokemon GO , Pokemon can only participate in Max Battles if they are also a Dynamax or Gigantamax Pokemon, themselves. For this reason, the choices that Trainers can bring into battle are fairly limited, making things a bit trickier than general Raid opportunities. A few key suitable counters have been identified below, based on the best Type Matchups and damage potential of each specimen.

  • Dynamax Grookey/Thwackey/Rillaboom are excellent choices due to their Grass Typing, which allows them to deal super effective damage against Dynamax Krabby.
  • Dynamax Bulbasaur/Ivysaur/Venusaur also stand out as strong options, as much like the Rillaboom line, their Grass Type enables them to dish out super effective damage against Dynamax Krabby.
  • Dynamax Toxtricity is another powerful contender, using its Electric Type attacks to deal huge damage to Dynamax Krabby.
  • If you don't have access to any of these Pokemon listed above, you may also choose to utilize whichever secondary or final evolution Dynamax Pokemon you have available that do not also share a Type that Krabby is resistant to. In this scenario, choices such as Dynamax Dubwool, Dynamax Greedent, Dynamax Haunter/Gengar, Dynamax Falinks, and Dynamax Machoke/Machamp are all suitable backups.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Player Wins Match By Dancing
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • COD player wins by dancing with Molotov, getting a final kill cam in a bizarre Search and Destroy round.
  • Molotov strategy can be used with any Emote in Black Ops 6, potentially changing the game dynamics.
  • Treyarch may address the Emoting Molotov strategy if it becomes problematic in Black Ops 6.

A Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 player won a match by dancing, thanks to a Molotov they had been holding. As Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has a vast arsenal, players have earned eliminations in many unique ways, but this may be the most bizarre one yet.

Since its release, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has included numerous game modes and playlists to choose from. Among the popular Black Ops 6 multiplayer game modes are Domination, Kill Confirmed, Gunfight, Team Deathmatch, and more. Search and Destroy is another mode carried forward from earlier entries, and it involves players activating or defending a bomb, or killing the entire enemy team in the process. While many players choose to focus on the match objective, others focus on defeating the enemy team. One gamer recently concluded a match of Search and Destroy bizarrely by dancing in a hallway with a Molotov equipped, and it paid off.

Reddit user SpawnTubing recently shared a clip from a Hardcore Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Search and Destroy match on the Rewind map. The video begins with the player activating the Black Ops 6 Season 1 Battle Pass Emote "Move Set," which is inspired by the Paris Olympics 2024 break dancer Raygun. The player does this behind a closed door leading to the A target located in Rewind's video store, and an enemy player soon approaches and eliminates them. As the gamer holds a Molotov during the Emote, it explodes in a ball of fire after they're defeated, and the round concludes with the other player's death. The clip then confirms that the Emoting player got the Final Kill thanks to their afterlife Molotov.

This Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Search and Destroy Round Ends With a Lethal Emote

While the Move Set Emote added extra flair to their final kill, this Molotov strategy can be utilized with any Emote. As this occurred in Black Ops 6 's Hardcore version of Search and Destroy, the Molotov did enough initial damage to defeat the enemy player. In most Core game modes, the Molotov will cause some damage at first, but the fire effect continues to reduce the affected player's health over time. According to SpawnTubing, their equipment behavior is set to toggle instead of hold to make tactics like this easier. As they failed to elaborate on the match, it's unclear if this Emote play contributed to their team winning Search and Destroy.

As Treyarch continues to update Black Ops 6 , more Emotes will likely be added to the game, expanding the possibilities of impressive kill cams like this. However, if this Emoting Molotov strategy becomes an issue in Black Ops 6 , Treyarch may patch the feature to remove the possibility of holding Lethal equipment under such circumstances.

item.title: Talented Animal Crossing Fan Makes Working Rattloid Replica
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • An Animal Crossing fan created a realistic rattloid replica using Blender and 3D printing.
  • The fan's accurate recreation of the rattloid impressed other community members.
  • Despite a lack of major updates, players continue to find joy and creativity in Animal Crossing: New Horizons.

Animal Crossing fans are likely familiar with the iconic gyroids that add a decorative flair to players' in-game home designs, and one talented Animal Crossing: New Horizons fan cleverly created a working rattloid replica. Animal Crossing: New Horizons community members have frequently shared their artistic creations that add a touch of the beloved franchise to their daily lives, and this incredibly cute rattloid has caught the eye of Animal Crossing fans.

Widely considered one of the most iconic life-sim video game franchises of all time, Animal Crossing sees players taking on the role of a young upstart who must cooperate with the local Villagers to make a happy life for themselves. While the Villagers in Animal Crossing are among the most recognizable elements from the series, simple items like furniture pieces have also earned a level of popularity among fans.

Animal Crossing: New Horizons fan Happyllami showed off their adorable rattloid replica, which is based on one of the beloved gyroids in Animal Crosssing . Gyroids are a furniture item in the Animal Crossing franchise and are often placed outside the front door of a player's home. Among the many unique varieties of gyroid is the rattloid, which contains a small sphere within its main structure, similar to a rattle. Happyllami decided to put their artistic skills to the test and recreated a pink and white rattloid in Blender which they then 3D printed. They coated the interior body and ball with paint and resin, then repeated the process with the lid and exterior. The cute little rattloid was finished by having its lid sealed, making it a fully functional rattloid, just like the ones in Animal Crossing: New Horizons .

Animal Crossing: New Horizons Rattloid Replica

Fellow fans praised the clever creation and admired its accuracy to the rattloids in the game. One comment teased that OP should make dozens more and bury them around for people to dig up, jokingly referencing how to find gyroids in Animal Crossing . In spite of no major content updates in some time, players have continued to enjoy their time in Animal Crossing: New Horizons , with some fans finding unique ways to bring the world of Animal Crossing to life.

Life-sim titles continue to draw in both casual and dedicated players, and the Animal Crossing game series remains an undeniable powerhouse of the genre. As many have their fingers crossed for potential announcements of the next release in the Animal Crossing franchise, others are content to keep exploring Animal Crossing: New Horizons and showing their love of the game with custom replicas and fun crafts.
